benchmark_details.name: CROW (Commonsense Reasoning in Real-World Tasks)
benchmark_details.overview: CROW is a manually-curated, multi-task benchmark that evaluates the ability of models to apply commonsense reasoning in the context of six real-world NLP tasks, using a multi-stage data collection pipeline that rewrites examples from existing datasets using commonsense-violating perturbations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the ability of NLP systems to apply commonsense reasoning in real-world tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Commonsense knowledge has many dimensions, and only six core ones are considered.

data.source: Constructed using existing datasets for six real-world NLP tasks.
data.annotation: Crowdsourced with validation by multiple annotators.

methodology.calculation: Macro-F1 is calculated as the average of scores across all tasks, while Situational Accuracy considers the correctness of responses across all targets for each context.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance of the models on commonsense reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance over various tasks serves as a baseline.
methodology.validation: Each stage of data collection included validation by multiple workers.
